item.title: 政变领导人承诺结束对石油的依赖，赢得加蓬大选
item.description: 加蓬军方领导人赢得了自两年前推翻政府以来的首次总统选举，从而巩固了自己的权力。【原文：Gabon’s military leader cemented his grip on power by winning the country’s first presidential election since he overthrew the government two years ago.】

item.title: 卡什卡利称美联储所能做的就是保持通胀稳定
item.description: 明尼阿波利斯联邦储备银行行长尼尔-卡什卡利（Neel Kashkari）表示，相信在投资者理清唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统不断变化的贸易政策之际，市场将保持有序，并称央行必须继续专注于保持通胀预期。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari signaled confidence that markets will remain orderly as investors sort through President Donald Trump’s shifting trade policies and said the central bank must stay focused on keeping inflation expectations anchored.】

item.title: 特朗普能源部长称平均油价将下降
item.description: 美国能源部长克里斯-赖特表示，本届美国政府的能源价格将低于上届政府。【原文：Energy prices are set to be lower under the current US administration than in the prior one, according to US Energy Secretary Chris Wright.】

item.title: 法国需要节约 400 亿欧元才能实现 2026 年赤字目标
item.description: 法国财政部长埃里克-隆巴（Eric Lombard）表示，法国需要再节省400亿欧元才能实现2026年的预算赤字目标。【原文：France will need to find a further €40 billion in savings to reach its 2026 budget deficit target, Finance Minister Eric Lombard said.】

item.title: 金融科技公司深入金融领域，Stripe大力发展银行业务
item.description: 一些金融科技公司制定了一项新战略，以应对与银行合作带来的风险和限制：自己成为一家银行。【原文：Some fintechs have a new strategy for navigating the risks and limitations associated with their partnerships with banks: Become a bank themselves.】

item.description: 特朗普政府征收关税带来的动荡正在强化人们的观点，即风险最高的资产未来将面临更多损失。【原文：The upheaval coming from the Trump administration’s tariffs is reinforcing views that the riskiest assets face more losses ahead.】

item.title: 索马里批准埃隆-马斯克的 "星链 "在该国运营
item.description: 索马里国家通信管理局周日向埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的 Starlink 公司颁发了许可证，允许该公司在该国开展服务。【原文：The National Communications Authority of Somalia awarded a license to Elon Musk’s Starlink on Sunday, allowing it to start services in the country.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）将数十亿美元押在米莱的电锯上，以避免过去的失败
item.description: 在阿根廷创纪录的金融救助计划失败六年后，国际货币基金组织再次投入数十亿美元，对这个陷入困境的南美经济体实施类似的救助战略，这一次是在哈维尔-米莱总统的领导下实施的。【原文：Six years after Argentina’s record financial bailout collapsed, the International Monetary Fund is again putting billions of dollars to backstop a similar rescue strategy for the troubled South American economy, this time under the leadership of President Javier Milei.】

item.title: 拯救钢铁业后，英国将对中国投资持更加怀疑态度
item.description: 英国商务大臣乔纳森-雷诺兹（Jonathan Reynolds）周日表示，在被迫拯救英国最后一家主要钢铁制造商之后，英国政府将对中国未来在敏感经济领域的投资采取更加怀疑的态度。【原文：The UK government will take a more skeptical approach to future Chinese investment in sensitive sectors of the economy after it was forced to rescue the country’s last primary steel manufacturer, Business Secretary Jonathan Reynolds said Sunday.】

item.title: 中国信贷扩张超出预期，债券大量发行
item.description: 由于中国政府加快发行债券，以帮助经济抵消美国对中国商品大幅加征关税的影响，中国 3 月份的信贷扩张超出预期。【原文：China’s credit expanded more than expected in March as the government accelerated bond offerings to help the economy offset the impact of surging US tariffs on Chinese goods.】

item.title: 美国重启核谈判，伊朗货币和股市攀升
item.description: 打破德黑兰核计划僵局、缓解与美国紧张关系的第一步刺激了伊朗货币和股票市场的反弹。【原文：A first step toward breaking the deadlock over Tehran’s nuclear program and easing tensions with the US spurred a rebound in Iran’s currency and stock markets.】

item.title: 奢侈巧克力制造商希望将 LVMH 集团支持的沙特品牌推向全球
item.description: 农场工人岌岌可危地悬挂在高耸的椰枣树顶上，煞费苦心地为椰枣树人工授粉。在短短几天内，大约有 10 万棵棕榈树需要施肥，今年春天的压力尤其大。【原文：Hanging precariously from the tops of towering date palms, farm workers painstakingly pollinate the trees by hand. With around 100,000 palms to fertilize in just days, the pressure is especially intense this spring.】

item.title: 伦敦最令人向往的街区减少了 1.1 万名工人
item.description: 长期以来，肯辛顿和切尔西一直吸引着愿意支付高昂房价的高收入者居住在伦敦最繁华的地区之一。现在，他们成千上万地离开了这里。【原文：Kensington and Chelsea has long attracted high-earning workers willing to pay exorbitant housing costs to live in one of London’s most glitzy districts. Now they are leaving in their thousands.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚拘留涉嫌棕榈油案受贿的法官
item.description: 印尼拘留了雅加达南区法院的首席法官和其他三人，他们涉嫌与 2022 年棕榈油出口腐败案有关的贿赂调查，该案涉及威玛国际有限公司（Wilmar International Ltd.）的一个部门。【原文：Indonesia has detained the chief judge of the South Jakarta District Court and three other people in a bribery investigation related to a 2022 palm oil export corruption case that involved a unit of Wilmar International Ltd.】

item.title: 日本不打算利用美国国债作为关税谈判的筹码
item.description: 在两国政府定于 4 月 17 日举行的会谈中，日本不打算将其持有的美国国债作为对抗美国关税的谈判工具。【原文：Japan isn’t planning to use its US Treasury holdings as a negotiation tool to counter US tariffs in talks scheduled between the two governments for April 17.】

item.title: 苹果印度公司生产 220 亿美元的 iPhone，从中国转移到印度
item.description: 在截至 3 月的 12 个月里，苹果公司在印度组装了价值 220 亿美元的 iPhone 手机，产量比上一年增加了近 60%，这表明该公司继续从中国向多元化发展。【原文：Apple Inc. assembled $22 billion worth of iPhones in India in the 12 months ended March, increasing production by nearly 60% over the previous year in a sign of continued diversification away from China.】

item.title: 全球基金将印度市场视为特朗普关税风暴中的避风港
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发起关税冲击后，中美贸易战愈演愈烈，全球投资者重新将印度资产视为相对安全的避风港。【原文：As the US-China trade war ramps up in the wake of Donald Trump’s tariff shock, global investors are refocusing on Indian assets as a relative safe haven.】

item.title: 各国央行准备七国集团对美国混乱局面的首次回应
item.description: 自唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战引发全球市场动荡以来，七国集团的首次货币政策决定可能会促使大西洋两岸做出不同的反应。【原文：The first Group of Seven monetary policy decisions since President Donald Trump’s trade war unleashed global market turmoil may prompt diverging responses from either side of the Atlantic.】

item.title: 橡树、TCW 和索纳在市场动荡中发现机遇
item.description: 中美贸易战引发了全球金融市场的剧烈波动，信贷投资者希望抓住由此带来的新机遇。【原文：Credit investors are looking to pounce on new opportunities resulting from the wild swings in global financial markets triggered by the US-China trade war.】

item.title: 德国默茨称特朗普关税有引发金融危机的风险
item.description: 德国候任总理弗里德里希-梅尔兹（Friedrich Merz）表示，唐纳德-特朗普的关税政策增加了金融危机的风险，并主张签署美欧自由贸易协定，他的这一主张引起了美国总统的敌意回应。【原文：German Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz said Donald Trump’s tariff policies increase the risk of a financial crisis and advocated for a US-European free trade agreement, picking up on an idea that has drawn a hostile response from the US president.】

item.title: 部长称土耳其遭遇 2014 年以来最严重寒流
item.description: 4 月份，土耳其遭遇了十多年来最严重的农业寒流，气温急剧下降，全国各地的农作物都受到了损害。【原文：Turkey suffered one of its worst agricultural cold snaps in more than a decade in April, with sharp drops in temperatures damaging crops across the country.】

item.title: 英国国会议员通过紧急法案拯救陷入困境的英国钢铁公司
item.description: 在基尔-斯塔默（Keir Starmer）领导的工党政府为保住英国最后一家原始钢铁制造商而斗争之际，英国议会通过了一项紧急法案，赋予部长们对敬业集团旗下英国钢铁公司的控制权。【原文：The UK Parliament passed an emergency bill to give ministers control over Jingye Group’s British Steel, as Keir Starmer’s Labour government fights to preserve Britain’s last virgin steelmaker.】

item.title: 美联储最深的关税担忧是不会消失的价格冲击
item.description: 如果唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）总统的关税措施抬高了美国的消费价格— 几乎所有人都认为至少在一段时间内会如此— 那么这对美联储的抗通胀人士来说已经是个坏消息了。它还可能为更糟糕的事情打开大门。【原文：If President Donald Trump’s tariffs jack up US consumer prices — as pretty much everyone thinks they will, at least for a while — then that’s already bad news for inflation-fighters at the Federal Reserve. It could also open the door to something even worse.】

item.title: 特朗普豁免手机、电脑和芯片的 "互惠 "关税
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的政府豁免了智能手机、电脑和其他电子产品的所谓互惠关税，这可能会减轻消费者的价格压力，同时使包括苹果公司（Apple Inc.【原文：President Donald Trump’s administration exempted smartphones, computers and other electronics from its so-called reciprocal tariffs, potentially cushioning consumers from sticker shock while benefiting electronics giants including Apple Inc. and Samsung Electronics Co.】

item.title: 据说 GTCR 接近达成以约 32 亿美元收购 OSTTRA 的交易
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，私募股权公司 GTCR 即将以约 32 亿美元的价格收购 OSTTRA，后者是一家在外汇和衍生品市场提供交易后服务的合资企业。【原文：Private equity firm GTCR is nearing a deal to buy OSTTRA, a venture that conducts post-trade services in the foreign exchange and derivatives markets, for about $3.2 billion, according to people familiar with the matter.】
